metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9490 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.20 to 2.4.43. A specially crafted value forthe 'Cache-Digest' header in a HTTP/2 request would result in a crash whenthe server actually tries to HTTP/2 PUSH a resource afterwards. Configuringthe HTTP/2 feature via "H2Push off" will mitigate this vulnerability forunpatched servers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9490` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
apache2-bin - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
apache2-data - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
apache2-utils - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1').
